unnormalised: **Quora Post: Builder Reviews - Real Estate & Property**
normalised: **Quora Post: Builder Reviews - Real Estate and Property**

unnormalised: Hey everyone, looking to buy a flat in Bangalore (Namma Bengaluru!) and seriously bogged down by the sheer number of builders. Has anyone else been through this?
normalised: Hey everyone, looking to buy a flat in Bangalore (Namma Bengaluru!) and seriously bogged down by the sheer number of builders. Has anyone else been through this?

unnormalised: I'm particularly stressed about finding reliable builder reviews. Forget those glossy brochures and slick marketing campaigns – I need honest feedback! I'm specifically looking at projects in the Whitefield area right now, and heard some mixed things about a couple of them.
normalised: I'm particularly stressed about finding reliable builder reviews. Forget those glossy brochures and slick marketing campaigns – I need honest feedback! I'm specifically looking at projects in the Whitefield area right now, and heard some mixed things about a couple of them.

unnormalised: Specifically, anyone have experience with Prestige Shantiniketan or Sobha Dream Acres? Or even smaller builders like, say, Rohan Builders who are also constructing around Outer Ring Road? I need to know if they deliver on time (promised possession was supposed to be 31/12/2023 for some projects, I've heard!), if the quality is good, and whether they honor their commitments. Are they transparent about the OC (Occupancy Certificate)? Did the final cost balloon significantly beyond the initial estimate (quoted me Rs. 75 Lakhs, but I fear the dreaded "extras")?
normalised: Specifically, anyone have experience with Prestige Shantiniketan or Sobha Dream Acres? Or even smaller builders like, say, Rohan Builders who are also constructing around Outer Ring Road? I need to know if they deliver on time (promised possession was supposed to be thirty first december two thousand and twenty three for some projects, I've heard!), if the quality is good, and whether they honor their commitments. Are they transparent about the O C (Occupancy Certificate)? Did the final cost balloon significantly beyond the initial estimate (quoted me rupee seventy five lakh, but I fear the dreaded "extras")?

unnormalised: I’ve heard horror stories from friends about delayed projects, shoddy construction, and builders disappearing after taking a hefty advance. Don’t want to end up in a consumer court case which could take years (and lots of Rs.!). Any insights, good or bad, would be greatly appreciated! Even stuff like parking space adequacy or whether the lift is always under maintenance at 17:00 hrs on Tuesdays would be helpful! I need to submit my loan application by 10/10/2024! Thanks in advance for your help!
normalised: I’ve heard horror stories from friends about delayed projects, shoddy construction, and builders disappearing after taking a hefty advance. Don’t want to end up in a consumer court case which could take years (and lots of rupees!). Any insights, good or bad, would be greatly appreciated! Even stuff like parking space adequacy or whether the lift is always under maintenance at five post meridiem on Tuesdays would be helpful! I need to submit my loan application by tenth october two thousand and twenty four! Thanks in advance for your help!
